Okay, so I looked this guy up and he in no uncertain terms mentioned 6 months ago that he thinks Zed should be nerfed. 
{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

> Removing the Reaping passive on zed's ult will nerf his earlygame quit abit, but that's not why it's there in the first place. The designer of Zed said while making him they needed to find a way to make sure once he got to late game he didn't just lose outright, The Reaping passive was so that Zed would be more of a niche pick and not bully out the rest of the assassins from being picked. I can tell you with certainty it does neither of those things. When Zed kills his enemy under deathmark at level 6, he will gain 8 AD for free along with 300gold(8 AD is worth 280g). As you can see this basically means he's killed you twice. The Reaping passive didn't change anything about how or when Zed should be picked, instead it added a really shitty mini game that nobody likes, and makes Zed's power curve wonky.

Do I agree with his opinion on how Zed should be balanced? No. But his facts presented go to show that Zed needs some kind of nerf, I can agree with that much. And I think his idea is certainly better than doing nothing at all.

He admitted a lot of things. First, that Zed can kill early easily, elsewise this wouldn't be an 'early game nerf' in the first place. Second, he admitted that a Zed that kills simply scales harder than other champs. Of course, we can say the same thing about Veigar and Cho'Gath. It's worth debating whether champs should have such mechanics, but it's in the game and some people(including me) find it fun. Maybe a compromise  could be reached where this mechanic of AD reaping could go on another champion, maybe Kayn after he completes his transformation, so that he isn't immediately doubling gold value from killing enemy champs in the early game. Just an example. Not saying whether Kayn needs or doesn't need changes/buffs/nerfs.

I mean, it’s called skill expression lmao.

The fact you can dodge his shit is enough. Why are you encouraging homogenization?

There's multiple ways of expressing skill. You just seem to be ignorant of the other ones. 

I've also seen numerous times that games have attempted to balance this kind of probabilistic skill expression against/with real time numerical calculations skill expression. It never works, because you can't simply assume the average hit rate in any particular instance. Making it impossible to balance a skill that has a statistical chance of X% to hit, but also balance it around how often it will actually be landing in MOST actual instantiations.

It's the same question that I always have with mobility or stealth being added as a defensive mechanic. How much effective HP (combination of HP * Armor/MR% reduction) is a lee sin E worth to another champion in order to balance them along side each other? Is that actually balanced or is that just balanced for the small proportion of the playerbase that fall almost exactly on that average? 

You want homogenization? Then the best way to achieve that is to balance around the statistical average and completely ignore the fact that most players fall outside of the first 0.67 std deviation (that contains ~50% of the population) from the average in, what is presumably, a normal distribution.
